sen.j: 織田信親（おだ のぶちか、嘉永3年12月25日 (旧暦)（1851年1月26日） - 昭和2年（1927年）10月30日）は丹波国丹波柏原藩第10代藩主、柏原藩知事。
sen.e: Nobuchika ODA (January 26, 1851 - October 30, 1927) was the 10th lord of Tanba Kaibara Domain, Tanba Province, and Governor of Kaibara Domain.
Nobuchika ODA (January 26, 1851 - October 30, 1927) was the 10th lord of Tanba Kaibara Domain, Tanba Province, and Governor of Kaibara Domain.
Nobuchika ODA (January 26, 1851 - October 30, 1927) was the 10th lord of Tanba Kaibara Domain, Tanba Province, and Governor of Kaibara Domain.

sen.j: 高長系織田家13代。
sen.e: He was the 13th head of ODA family of TAKANAGA group.
He was the 13th head of ODA family of TAKANAGA group.
He was the 13th head of ODA family of TAKANAGA group.

sen.j: 交代寄合（のち備中国成羽藩主）・山崎治正の三男。
sen.e: He was the third son of Harumasa YAMAZAKI, Kotaiyoriai (alternate yoriai, a family status of samurai warriors in the Edo period), (later the lord of Nariwa Domain, Bitchu Province).
He was the third son of Harumasa YAMAZAKI, Kotaiyoriai (alternate yoriai, a family status of samurai warriors in the Edo period), (later the lord of Nariwa Domain, Bitchu Province).
He was the third son of Harumasa YAMAZAKI, Kotaiyoriai (alternate yoriai, a family status of samurai warriors in the Edo period), (later the lord of Nariwa Domain, Bitchu Province).

sen.j: 養父は丹波柏原藩主織田信民。
sen.e: His foster father was Nobutami ODA, the lord of Kaibara Domain, Tanba Province.
His foster father was Nobutami ODA, the lord of Kaibara Domain, Tanba Province.
His foster father was Nobutami ODA, the lord of Kaibara Domain, Tanba Province.

sen.j: 正室は新庄直敬の長女詮子。
sen.e: His lawful wife was Senshi, the first daughter of Naotaka Shinjo.
His lawful wife was Senshi, the first daughter of Naotaka Shinjo.
His lawful wife was Senshi, the first daughter of Naotaka Shinjo.

sen.j: 子は織田信大（長男）。
sen.e: His first son was Nobuhiro ODA.
His first son was Nobuhiro ODA.
His first son was Nobuhiro ODA.

sen.j: 幼名は英太郎。
sen.e: His childhood name was Eitaro.
His childhood name was Eitaro.
His childhood name was Eitaro.

sen.j: 初名は治安、信成。
sen.e: His original names were Haruyrasu and Nobunari.
His original names were Haruyasu and Nobunari.
His original names were Haruyasu and Nobunari.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下出雲守、後に従二位。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and he served as Izumo-no-Kami, and later Junii (Junior Second Rank).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and he served as Izumo-no-Kami, and later Junii (Junior Second Rank).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and he served as Izumo-no-Kami, and later Junii (Junior Second Rank).

sen.j: 爵位は子爵。
sen.e: His peerage was Viscount.
His peerage was Viscount.
His peerage was Viscount.

sen.j: 嘉永3年（1850年）12月25日誕生。
sen.e: He was born on December 25, 1850.
He was born on December 25, 1850.
He was born on January 26, 1851.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更して、最初の日付に合わせました。

sen.j: 慶応元年（1865年）12月14日 (旧暦)、丹波柏原藩主織田信民の末期養子として家督を相続する。
sen.e: Nobuchika succeeded to the reigns of his family as a Matsugo yoshi (adopted son on one's deathbed) of Nobutami ODA, the lord of Kaibara Domain, Tanba Province.
In 1865, Nobuchika succeeded to the reigns of his family as a Matsugo yoshi (adopted son on one's deathbed) of Nobutami ODA, the lord of Kaibara Domain, Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: ･追記In 1865旧暦12月14日については、新暦への換算不能でしたので、未記載としました。
sen.e: On January 30, 1866, Nobuchika succeeded to the reigns of his family as a Matsugo yoshi (adopted son on one's deathbed) of Nobutami ODA, the lord of Kaibara Domain, Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 先々代藩主織田信敬は細川行芬の三男であった。
sen.e: Nobunori ODA, the former lord of the Domain was the third son of Yukika HOSOKAWA.
sen.cmt: 先々代の訳がわかりませんでした。
sen.e: Nobunori ODA, the former lord of the Domain but one was the third son of Yukika HOSOKAWA.
sen.cmt: ・「前々～」を、the former but oneとして訳しました。
sen.e: Nobunori ODA, the former lord of the Domain but one was the third son of Yukika HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: また、信親の実父山崎治正の継室は細川行芬の娘であった。
sen.e: In addition, the second wife of Harumasa YAMAZAKI, the biological fatehr of Nobuchika, was a daughter of Yukika HOSOKAWA.
In addition, the second wife of Harumasa YAMAZAKI, the biological father of Nobuchika, was a daughter of Yukika HOSOKAWA.
In addition, the second wife of Harumasa YAMAZAKI, the biological father of Nobuchika, was a daughter of Yukika HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: こうした血縁関係により、織田信親は織田家の養子に迎えられたと思われる。
sen.e: Because of these blood relations, Nobuchika ODA seems to have been accepted as an adopted child of ODA family.
Because of these blood relations, Nobuchika ODA seems to have been accepted as an adopted child of ODA family.
Because of these blood relations, Nobuchika ODA seems to have been accepted as an adopted child of ODA family.

sen.j: 慶応2年（1866年）12月18日、従五位下出雲守に叙任する。
sen.e: On December 18, 1866, he was conferred Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Izumo-no-kami.
On December 18, 1866, he was conferred Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Izumo-no-kami.
On January 23, 1867, he was conferred Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Izumo-no-kami.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）11月19日、朝廷の求めに応じて上洛する。
sen.e: On November 19, 1867, he went to the capital (Kyoto) at the request of the Imperial Court.
On November 19, 1867, he went to the capital (Kyoto) at the request of the Imperial Court.
On December 14, 1867, he went to the capital (Kyoto) at the request of the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 翌慶応4年（1868年）1月の鳥羽・伏見の戦いの際には、新政府軍に加わり、京都御所などの警備にあたる。
sen.e: In January,1868, during the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, Nobuchika joined the new government army, where he was in charge of guarding at Kyoto Imperial Palace.
In January,1868, during the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, Nobuchika joined the new government army, where he was in charge of guarding at Kyoto Imperial Palace.
In January,1868, during the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, Nobuchika joined the new government army, where he was in charge of guarding at Kyoto Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 小大名でありながら、かなり早い段階から新政府側に組している。
sen.e: Despite being a feudal lord, he was on the side of the new government from quite an early stage.
Despite being a feudal lord, he was on the side of the new government from quite an early stage.
Despite being a feudal lord, he was on the side of the new government from quite an early stage.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）6月22日 (旧暦)、柏原藩知事に就任する。
sen.e: On June 22, 1869, he took office as Governor of Kaibara Domain.
On June 22, 1869, he took office as Governor of Kaibara Domain.
On July 20, 1869, he took office as Governor of Kaibara Domain.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）7月15日 (旧暦)、廃藩置県により免職。
sen.e: On July 15, 1871, he was dismissed from Governor due to Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
On July 15, 1871, he was dismissed from Governor due to Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
On August 30, 1871, he was dismissed from Governor due to Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 明治4年10月15日、旧領柏原において農業に従事することを願う帰農届を承認される。
sen.e: On October 15, 1871, his application for taking up farming again in the former territory of Kaibara was approved.
On October 15, 1871, his application for taking up farming again in the former territory of Kaibara was approved.
On November 27, 1871, his application for taking up farming again in the former territory of Kaibara was approved.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 明治6年2月4日柏原の邸宅が全焼し、一族の千賀正遠の邸宅に移り謹慎する。
sen.e: As his residence was completely burnt down on February 4, 1873, he moved to the residence of 千賀正遠, who was one of his family members, and he reflected on what he had done.
As his residence was completely burnt down on February 4, 1873, he moved to the residence of 千賀正遠, who was one of his family members, and he reflected on what he had done.
As his residence was completely burnt down on February 4, 1873, he moved to the residence of 千賀正遠, who was one of his family members, and he reflected on what he had done.

sen.j: 明治15年（1882年）11月16日に宮内省に出仕、華族局に配属。
sen.e: On November 16, 1882, he entered government service, where he was assigned to Peerage agency.
On November 16, 1882, he entered government service, where he was assigned to Peerage agency.
On November 16, 1882, he entered government service, where he was assigned to Peerage agency.

sen.j: 明治18年（1885年）12月28日、依願退職。
sen.e: On December 28, 1885, he voluntary retired.
On December 28, 1885, he voluntary retired.
On December 28, 1885, he voluntary retired.

sen.j: この間、明治17年（1884年）には子爵になっている。
sen.e: During this period, in 1884, the title of Viscount was bestowed on him.
During this period, in 1884, the title of Viscount was bestowed on him.
During this period, in 1884, the title of Viscount was bestowed on him.

sen.j: 明治23年（1890年）7月22日、主猟官に就任。
sen.e: On July 22, 1890, he assumed Shuryokan.
On July 22, 1890, he assumed Shuryokan (Imperial Hunting administration officer).
sen.cmt: ok・主猟官について調査すると、「主猟官ハ十五人内二人ヲ勅任十三人ヲ奏任トシ共ニ名誉官トス狩猟ノ事ヲ掌ル」とありましたので、(Imperial Hunting administration officer) として補足説明をつけました。
sen.e: On July 22, 1890, he assumed Shuryokan (Imperial Hunting administration officer).

sen.j: 大正10年（1921年）高齢を理由に主猟官を辞職する。
sen.e: In 1921, he resigned as Shuryokan due to advanced age.
In 1921, he resigned as Shuryokan due to advanced age.
In 1921, he resigned as Shuryokan due to advanced age.

sen.j: 昭和2年（1927年）10月30日死去、享年77。
sen.e: He died on October 30, 1927, at the age of 77.
He died on October 30, 1927, at the age of 77.
He died on October 30, 1927, at the age of 77.
